compiler
Class Expression

java.lang.Object
  compiler.Expression

public class Expression
extends java.lang.Object

An expression consisting of a single Term, followed by zero or more ADDOP TERM pairs. ADDOP is + or -

Author:
Michael Pinnegar

Field Summary

          List of addops (+/-).

          Very first term.

          List of Term.

          This constructor builds an expression from the source code found in body.

Field Detail

terms

private java.util.ArrayList<Term> terms
List of Term. Goes [ADDOP->TERM] in pairs.

addops

private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> addops
List of addops (+/-). Goes [ADDOP->TERM] in pairs.

first

private Term first
Very first term. Has no addop pair.

counter

private static int counter
Counter used to uniquely label the nodes of the tree representation of the source code. Node numbers are used in the linearization of the tree's expressions, where it is converted into source code.

Constructor Detail

Expression

public Expression(TextFile body)
This constructor builds an expression from the source code found in body.

Parameters:
body - source code
Method Detail

incrementCounter

public static void incrementCounter()
Adds one to the counter.

getCounterVal

public static int getCounterVal()
Retrieves the value of the counter.

Returns:
counter value

compile

public int compile(TextFile flag)
Adds the VMC representation of this expression to the compiled code. Returns the integer numbering of the expression's node in the tree structure.

Parameters:
flag - unfinished compiled code
Returns:
expression's node numbering

print

public void print()
Prints out the elements of this expression as they were taken in as source code. Useful for verifying that the intermediate tree structure has been built correctly.
